chess

Class Chess.King

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess.Piece
      • chess.Chess.King
  • Enclosing class:
    Chess

    public static class Chess.King
extends Chess.Piece
    Rook class and King class are the only Pieces to have an additional field to other Pieces. They store a boolean has_moved that is false until they have moved. This boolean is used when a King tries to castle since castling is only allowed when both the King and the Rook have not moved. See Chess.Rook
    Author:
    Jake

      • has_moved

        public boolean has_moved

    • Constructor Detail

      • King

        public King(char file,
            int rank)
        Constructor initializes the piece's name as "K", its file as the input file, its rank as the input rank. A "w" or "b" is added before the name and its white_side value is set when the piece is created in Chess.initialize()
        Parameters:
        file - - the file where the piece was created
        rank - - the rank where the piece was created

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String move_to)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Kings may move to any space adjacent to any space adjacent to them as long as there is not a piece of the same side in that position and the move will not place it in check. Kings may also castle if they have not yet moved, have a clear path to one of the rooks, and that rook has not moved. King's move method is the only move method that moves another Piece, which is the Rook that is moved during castling. A King may not castle if it moves through a check or if it will be in check after the castling. If a move is valid, this piece's position is changed in the global board and its own file and rank fields are updated

        King's move method does not call putsOwnKingInCheck since it was written before that method existed. Instead, each move is checked to ensure it does not place this King in check in the move method itself.

        Specified by:
        move in class Chess.Piece
        Parameters:
        move_to - a two part String with the file and the rank that they are to move to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the move_to position is not valid

      • check

        public boolean check(Chess.Piece[][] board)
        check checks the positions in the inputed board that this piece can capture in to see if the opponent side's King is there. In the checkForCheck method if check returns true, checkmate is called. Check does not call checkmate itself since the check may be in a temporary board used in testing like the ones used in allValidMoves method
        Specified by:
        check in class Chess.Piece
        Parameters:
        board - - the board the that check is being tested in. This can be the global board or a temporary board created in putsOwnKingInCheck for instance
        Returns:
        true if it is checking the opponent King, false otherwise

      • allValidMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allValidMoves()
        Returns all the positions that this piece can move to as an ArrayList of Strings. Each String is 2 characters consisting of a file and a rank
        Specified by:
        allValidMoves in class Chess.Piece
        Returns:
        ArrayList of strings of FileRank format of all the places this piece can move to
